howItWorks.title: What is an "Empty Leg"?
howItWorks.description1: An empty leg flight, also called a "positioning flight", is a private aircraft flying empty after dropping off passengers, or on its way to pick up passengers.
howItWorks.description2: Since the aircraft has to make this flight anyway, charter companies offer these "empty" seats at a significant discount - often up to 75% off the normal price.
howItWorks.description3: Jetleg centralizes the supply from hundreds of reliable operators, so you can easily find and book the perfect deal. It's the smartest way to experience the luxury of private flying.

hero.title: Frequently Asked Questions
hero.subtitle: Find answers to the most frequently asked questions about empty leg flights and our platform.

general.title: General
questions: What is an empty leg flight?
answers: Jetleg is a platform specialized in empty leg flights - private jet flights that would otherwise fly empty. We offer these flights at heavily reduced prices, making private jet travel more accessible.

An empty leg flight occurs when a private jet has to return to its base without passengers, or has to move to a new location for the next client. Instead of flying empty, operators offer these flights at reduced prices.
Empty leg flights can be up to 75% cheaper than regular private jet charters. The exact savings depend on the route, aircraft type and timing of the flight.
Absolutely. All flights are operated by certified operators who meet the highest safety standards. Our partners have all necessary licenses and certifications for commercial flights.

booking.title: Booking and Payment
questions: How do I book a flight?
Which payment methods do you accept?
answers: Booking is simple: search for a flight on our website, select your desired option, fill in your details and pay securely online. You will receive immediate confirmation by email.
We accept all major credit cards (Visa, Mastercard, American Express), iDEAL, bank transfer and other local payment methods depending on your location.
Cancellation conditions vary per flight and operator. In general, empty legs are less flexible than regular charters. Always check the specific conditions when booking.
Yes, after payment you automatically receive an invoice by email. For business bookings we can provide customized invoices with your company details.

flights.title: Flight Details
questions: How far in advance are empty legs available?
Can I change the departure time?
answers: Empty legs are often available last-minute, from a few hours to a maximum of 2 weeks in advance. Most deals are published 24-72 hours in advance.
Limited flexibility is possible, but changes depend on the operator and flight schedule. Small adjustments (1-2 hours) are sometimes possible for an additional fee.
In bad weather we follow standard aviation protocols. Flights may be delayed or cancelled for your safety. In that case you get a full refund or alternative options.
Standard catering is usually included. Special dietary requirements or premium catering may incur additional costs. This is clearly indicated when booking.

practical.title: Practical matters
questions: How much baggage can I take?
Do I have to check in earlier?
answers: Baggage limits vary by aircraft type. Generally 20-30kg hand luggage and 20-50kg hold luggage is allowed. You can see exact limits in the flight details.
Check-in is much faster for private jets. Arrive 15-30 minutes before departure at the terminal. At smaller airports this can be even shorter.
Pets are often allowed on private jets, depending on the operator and destination. Ask about specific rules and any additional costs when booking.
You need a valid passport for international flights and an identity card for domestic flights. Check visa requirements for your destination.
